page.title: 09PANGBOURNE A - 3 6376
page.content: 4p for 4 wheels; 6p for six or more wheels. There is a weight limit of 10 tons. {St. James the less Church:} Churches have stood on this site since 11th Century. It was rebuilt in 1866 when near collapsing. Its stained glass windows designed by William Morris are 60 years old.{Bere {Court,}a nearby house, was acquired in 1613 by Sir John Davis whose tomb is behind the organ. {Police Station:} It consists of an office for enquiries; offices for sergeants and inspectors; the parade room for daily notices; the yard; a kennel; a cell for one prisoner; a charge room for questioning and photographing prisoners; a bar, a club room and rest room. Land Use: Residential/shops etc.
